body.p:
To
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin, Govenor of The Commonwealth of Kentucky.

We, the undersigned, citizens of Caldwell County Ky, have long Known Thomas. B. Wadlington & he has ever been considered a good & true hearted citizen, Known & noted for his industry & his orderly & peaceable conduct -- The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A. Cartwright, did not appear to us, to be of his seeking. Nor are we satisfied that the case was fairly presented to the Jury, as it occured. We hope your Excellency will review the case, and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt or desire, that his case may be judged of in Mercy & regarded with favor -- And that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance, that ought to operate in his behalf. And we desire & hope that your Excellency may be persuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him Executive Clemency, and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon or a commutation of his punishment -- Jany 21 1861.

John ^his X mark^ Tobary
J. W. Holeman
A. S. ^his X mark^ Smith
Sam ^his X mark^ Holeman
Wm. H. Morehead
William Jones
Jonas Frazer
Thomas Jones
S.. A. Crowell
W. M. ^his X^ Crowell
W. K. Stromall
R H ^his X mark^ Ramsey
Samuel M. D, graham
G. W ^his X^ Riley
^made his mark X^ Hannoc
R L ^his X mark^ Crowel
S, W. Calvert
State of Ky Caldwell County
Z. Weeks says that he was present & saw the above named persons sign the foregoing petition,
Sworn to before me by Z. Weeks this Jany 28 1861
